data: Nurse to initiate the Day of Procedure phase of this powerplan on the day of procedure
If patient is unable to give informed consent, please arrange for a family member/legal guardian to accompany patient to the department. Consent must be obtained by a physician
If eGFR is LESS than 45 mL/min consider using various clinical characteristics to evaluate prospectively the potential risk of developing post PCI contrast-induced nephropathy
For patients requiring cardioversion on non-vitamin K dependent oral anticoagulants (NOACs) please ensure compliance for the past 4 weeks and please consider TEE with suboptimal compliant patients.
Pregnancy testing for women of childbearing age
once, For women with childbearing potential
Prepare surgical site with clippers, 3 inch radius around marked implant site
Do not insert urinary catheter prior to transcatheter transfemoral heart valve implantation
Encourage PO fluid intake to prevent dehydration
8 hours prior to PCI and Angiogram, may have clear fluids until 3 hours prior to procedure
8 hours prior to Permanent Pacemaker and ICD Implantation. May have clear fluids until 6 hours
8 hours prior to electrophysiology studies and ablation procedure; may have clear fluids until 6 hours prior to procedure
8 hours prior to Transcatheter Heart Valve Implantation, may have clear fluids until 3 hours prior to procedure

If patient requires General Anesthesia, patient to be NPO 6 hours prior to ASD/PFO closure. If patient does not require General Anesthesia, patient to be NPO 3 hours prior to ASD/PFO closure, may take medication with sips
Stop enteral tube feeding 8 hours prior to procedure in a non-intubated non-ventilated patient
For intubated ventilated patients, stop and aspirate the NG-tube /OG-tube immediately prior to transfer to cardiac catheterization Lab
Refer to Contrast - Induced Nephropathy (CIN) protocol if eGFR LESS than 45 mL/min and NOT on dialysis
order rate: 1 mL/kg/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 2 mL/kg/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 3 mL/kg/h, IV, drug form: bag
In the morning pre cardiac procedure patient may take own medications, except oral hypoglycemic agents and insulin
If patient on long-acting insulin, give one-half usual dose on AM of procedure
Hold anticoagulation, confirm with triage coordinator for when to discontinue
Constant Order, Clinical event: Pre Cardiac Procedure, Medication(s) to be held: metFORMIN, Instructions: Hold 24 hours pre-procedure
Constant Order, Clinical event: Pre Cardiac Procedure, Medication(s) to be held: NSAID, Instructions: Hold 24 hours pre-procedure if eGFR is LESS than 45 mL/min
Constant Order, Clinical event: Pre Cardiac Procedure, Medication(s) to be held: anti-hypertensive medications, Instructions: in the morning pre-procedure
Constant Order, Clinical event: Pre Cardiac Procedure, Medication(s) to be held: diuretic (e.g. furosemide, hydrochlorothiazide), Instructions: Hold on day pre-procedure
Constant Order, Clinical event: Pre Cardiac Procedure, Medication(s) to be held: insulin regular, Instructions: Hold on day of procedure

Constant Order, Clinical event: Pacemaker and ICD Implantation, Medication(s) to be held: enoxaparin, Instructions: If likely to undergo permanent pacemaker and ICD implantation prior to 12:00 HOLD dose evening prior to procedure and morning of procedure

Constant Order, Clinical event: Pacemaker and ICD Implantation, Medication(s) to be held: enoxaparin, Instructions: If likely to undergo permanent pacemaker and ICD implantation after 12:00 HOLD dose morning of procedure
Constant Order, Clinical event: Pre Cardiac Procedure, Medication(s) to be held: LMWH, Instructions: Hold morning of procedure
Constant Order, Clinical event: Pre Cardiac Procedure, Medication(s) to be held: ASA, Instructions: day of procedure or 3 days pre-procedure
Constant Order, Clinical event: Pre Cardiac Procedure, Medication(s) to be held: DOACs, Instructions: Hold apixaban, dabigatran, edoxaban or rivaroxaban 2 days pre-procedure
Constant Order, Clinical event: Pre Cardiac Procedure, Medication(s) to be held: P2Y12 Inhibitors, Instructions: (e.g. clopidogrel, prasugrel or ticagrelor) 48 hours or 7 days pre-procedure
Constant Order, Clinical event: Pre Cardiac Procedure, Medication(s) to be held: warfarin, Instructions: 5 days pre-procedure

Constant Order, Clinical event: Pre Cardiac Procedure, Medication(s) to be held: dabigatran, Instructions: 3 days pre-procedure (eGFR greater than 50 mL/min), 5 days pre-procedure (eGFR 30 to 50 mL/min), 7 days pre-procedure (eGFR less than 30 mL/min)
Constant Order, Clinical event: Pre Cardiac Procedure, Medication(s) to be held: factor Xa inhibitors, Instructions: (e.g. rivaroxaban or apixaban) 48 hours or 72 hours pre-procedure

Constant Order, Clinical event: Pre Cardiac Procedure, Medication(s) to be held: low molecular weight heparin, Instructions: 24 hours pre-procedure for enoxaparin and 36 hours pre-procedure for dalteparin
Constant Order, Clinical event: Pre Cardiac Procedure, Medication(s) to be held: ACE inhibitors/ARB, Instructions: (e.g. ramipril and candesartan) 48 hours pre-procedure
Constant Order, Clinical event: Pre Cardiac Procedure, Medication(s) to be held: diuretics, Instructions: morning of procedure (e.g. furosemide, hydroCHLOROthiazide, metOLazone)
Constant Order, Clinical event: Pre Cardiac Procedure, Medication(s) to be held: diabetics medications, Instructions: (e.g. glyburide, gliclazide, linagliptin, metformin, insulin) on day of procedure
Constant Order, Clinical event: Pre Cardiac Procedure, Medication(s) to be held: SGLT-2 inhibitors, Instructions: (e.g. canagliflozin, dapagliflozin, empagliflozin) 48 hours pre-procedure
Constant Order, Clinical event: Pre Cardiac Procedure, Medication(s) to be held: IV heparin Infusion, Instructions: on call to OR /  Cath Lab
Confirm with triage coordinator for when to discontinue heparin, enoxaparin, warfarin, antiplatelet agents, NOAC, aspirin, Low-molecular-weight heparin (LMWH)
